titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Mary Jo Sweeney Collection, 1829-1948
titlestmt.author: Zachary Hottel

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid derived from being created directly into EAD, created by Zachary Hottel, 18 February 2018

titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Mary Jo Sweeney Collection, 1829-1948
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Shenandoah County Library 2017-0013

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: A collection of items donated by Mary Jo Sweeney of Woodstock Virginia. They include documents and a family bible highlighting the history of her family. In addition, there are two scrapbooks created by Mary Jo between 1943 and 1948.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open to researchers without restrictions.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to all copyright laws and archives policies before using the collection. Please contact the Shenandoah County Library before visiting to use this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Mary Jo Sweeney Collection, 1829-1948, Truban Archives, Shenandoah County Library, Edinburg, Virginia, USA. [Identification of item], Mary Jo Sweeney Collection, Collection number 2017-0013, [Series Name], Truban Archives, Shenandoah County Library, Edinburg, Virginia, USA.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Donated by Mary Jo Sweeney of Woodstock Virginia.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection consists of three boxes. It is sorted by material type and chronologically within each box.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Mary Jo Sweeney is a life-long resident of Woodstock Virginia. She was born in 1929 and graduated from the Woodstock High School in 1947. After which she attended Madison College, now James Madison University. Mary Jo also has strong connections to her church, Emanuel Lutheran of Woodstock Virginia.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged as it was presented by Mary Jo Sweeney.
